author: Misaki
content: Hit us up at Akashi's Crepe Stand! We've got more flavors than you can shake a stick at!

comments.content: Thanks for the help with setting it all up, nya! Now I know why they call you the queen of all trades, nya.

replies.content: Haha, don't worry about it, just happy to help!

comments.content: Another part-time job, sis? This time, making crepes?

replies.content: Yup! I got my favorite: mango vanilla! Stop by later and we'll treat you to one!
Really? Well, why not. I'll have the same, then!

comments.content: We came, we saw, we all had good crepes (/・ω・)/

replies.content: Yes. I had several, and they were all delicious.
I did the contrarian thing and got a different flavor to everyone else... It tasted really nice.
With so many flavors you can pick from, you almost get choice overload...
Glad you all enjoyed it! ^o^

comments.content: Commander's log: tried the mango vanilla. It was delish.

replies.content: I know, right? So glad we managed to get it on the menu!
Thank you for your patronyage~

comments.content: Heard business is booming thanks to your hard work.

replies.content: It sure is, but hard work? I'm barely breaking a sweat! ^w^

author: Nagisa
content: Sat down with a friend and talked about stuff over drinks!

comments.content: We're on the same wavelength, you and I! And we think alike about our little sisters. I wish we'd met sooner.

replies.content: Oh, I agree! It's almost criminal that we never met before today.
MY LITTLE SISTER DISCOURSE SENSE IS TINGLING! Let me tell you all about my little Indy! She's just the cutest in the universe!
Portland, please... You're embarrassing me...

comments.content: Sounds like you had a good time together. Good for you, sis!

replies.content: Time for the ol' checklist. Has a little sister: check. Attitude problems: check. Small bust... check.
OH MY GOD, I CAN'T BELIEVE YOU'VE DONE THIS!
Hey, you're right... Hipper's response sounds a bit like what Nagisa might say.
What?! Well, kind of, but not... not really?!

comments.content: You seem like you'd have a lot in common.

replies.content: We do. Our little sisters, for starters. So much to talk about!

comments.content: You could both use a chill pill every now and then.

replies.content: Excuse me? Are you saying I'm not perfectly chill at all times?!

author: Marie Rose
content: A cup of milk a day keeps bone fragility at bay!

comments.content: Nothing like a bottle of cool milk after a hot bath!

replies.content: Oh, that too! Me, I drink it more for the nutritional benefits!

comments.content: You're making me thirsty. I could go for a drink...

replies.content: Well, relevant to the topic at hand, how about some milk? You may find it beneficial in surprising ways!
I have a feeling like Laffey already has a drink in mind, and it isn't milk...

comments.content: We concur! Milk is truly the finest beverage available!

replies.content: It's smooth, yummy, and promotes growth! What's not to like?
Really? Then maybe I should start drinking it regularly too.
You?! Absolutely not! Destroyers will start getting trapped in orbit around you if you grow any bigger!
What...? Sorry, I don't follow...

comments.content: Milk is udderly delicious.

replies.content: That's part of the reason why I drink it every day!

comments.content: The best friend of any growing child: milk.

replies.content: Hey! I'm not a child anymore!

author: REPORTER_AOBA
content: Best pic from the beach photoshoot: Monica's GOAT receive!

comments.content: Oh, you're such a talented photographer, Aoba! It is a bit embarrassing though, seeing a picture of myself...

replies.content: Hey, kudos to you for making the shot possible! It's an eyecatcher in more ways than one.
Why, thanks! Let me know if you're ever doing another shoot!

comments.content: She beat me, both in volleyball and in bounciness T-T

replies.content: Don't be sad, we did the best we could, Sara!
I know... But while we lost in volleyball together, you at least tied in the bounciness department...
Wh-what?! Nobody told me we'd be graded on that, too!

comments.content: Nice... receive. Yeah, let's go with that.

replies.content: Something caught your eye, Commander? In any case, thanks~

comments.content: First cards, now volleyball! What can't you do?

replies.content: When the stakes are sufficiently high, there's no game I won't play!

author: Nyotengu
content: I lay eyes upon a delectable manjuu. It is of the edible variety, no?

comments.content: Well, their fluffy form certainly does make them look like manjuu buns.

replies.content: Ah-haha, nearly did I bite right into it. It is good I did not.

comments.content: You're invited to try Akagi's manjuus. Of the bird variety.

replies.content: Oho. A most peculiar food by the sound of it, but I am curious to taste it.
I recommend starting from the head and working your way down, hehe~

comments.content: Et tu, brute?!

replies.content: Fret not. I only laid my eyes upon it, never sunk my teeth into it.

comments.content: That's a sweet-looking sandjuu!

replies.content: Thanks! Honoka and I are calling it the Monumental Manjuu!
Sublime craftsmanship! Very nice.

comments.content: New task received: construct even sublimer sand castle...!

replies.content: Settle down. You already broke plenty of records with that last one.
I remember seeing pictures of that one! Gascogne just can't be beaten when it comes to sand castles!
I must admit, ours doesn't really rival hers... Honoka, we'll just have to build an even better one!
You're on!

comments.content: It's even got a lifelike texture.

replies.content: You can attribute the degree of realism to the Manjuu model we had on hand!

comments.content: You make quite the dream team, eh?

replies.content: Yep! The dream team doing teamwork to make the dream work!

author: Nin_Kuroshio
content: We made a new friend and had a fun chat about ninjutsu.

comments.content: I know I chose this pose, but looking back at it now, it's a bit silly...

replies.content: Really? I think the three of you look awesome together!

comments.content: The honorable Kasumi and Kuroshio and I spoke, sharing ninja secrets with one another! I hope to do it again sometime!

replies.content: I wouldn't call them secrets, but yeah, it was fun! I'd love to do it again too.

comments.content: Why wasn't I invited? I've got some fun anecdotes to share as well.

replies.content: You're absolutely invited to join us for the next meet! Let's mark our calendars for sometime this month.
Agreed. You are hereby cordially invited to our nin-chat-su party.
I echo this sentiment!

comments.content: The ninjas are unionizing!

replies.content: Just gathering for a friendly exchange! Or at least, that's what we want you to think... *wink*

comments.content: Now you just need matching uniforms.

replies.content: The ninja makes the uniform, not the other way around.
She's right! Although, black would look cool on Kasumi!

author: Marie Rose
content: #MaidForADay I learned so much thanks to Belfast and the Royal Maids!

comments.content: I must say, you are quite the fast learner, Marie. You'll be fit to serve Her Highness in no time if you continue your training.

replies.content: I am very service-minded, being Lady Helena's servant, after all! However, I need to learn more about your peculiar Royal Navy customs.
It seems Belfast has a new apprentice.

comments.content: Oh my gosh, Marie, you're just the cutest (*▽)

replies.content: Um, thank you, Edinburgh... I do appreciate the things you taught me, by the way. Like how to brew good tea, and so forth.
Just don't overload her with new things, Edinburgh.
Right, I won't... I do wish you could be a little more friendly, like Marie is.

comments.content: Maid for a day? Sounds fun! Where do I sign up?

replies.content: Talk to Belfast! She'll help you get started.

comments.content: Sounds like you'd make a natural maid.

replies.content: Hehehe! It wasn't super serious maid training, but I still went all-out!

comments.content: Is it just me, or does Belfast look unusually content?

replies.content: She was so earnest that I couldn't help but find her endearing.

author: Misaki
content: I spy with my little eye a Nagisa, rehearsing her lines!

comments.content: You took a photo of it too?! Geesh...

replies.content: I just had to! You look all cute when you blush. Do you want me to delete it, though? If you don't like it...
A little late for that now... But you know what? It's fine.

comments.content: If I may ask: lines for what?

replies.content: Oh, well, I work as a stage actress. Stuff like this is just part of my job description.
And she's a heckin' good actress, I'll have you know!
It's one thing to say the lines on stage, but it's a bit weird when people listen to you practicing them...

comments.content: Mind if I come and watch your rehearsal?

replies.content: Yes, I do. And if I catch you spying on me, you'll regret it, you silly dog!

author: Monica
content: Think you can read MY poker face?

comments.content: Poker? Isn't that a game for grownups?! Σ(ﾟДﾟ)

replies.content: There's more than one thing only meant for adults in this image...
How long would it take for us to learn this "poker" game?
THAT type of poker requires a certain type of... adult mindset.

comments.content: Hahah! I might know me a thing or two about card games! Let's see what you've got!

replies.content: It's not limited to cards! Roulette, dice, slots, you name it, we can play it.

comments.content: I see you've got an ace up your cleave. If that's not the perfect thing to distract the Commander with, I dunno what is.

replies.content: Mhm~ I may still be learning the art of dealing, but it's little things like this that give you the house edge.

comments.content: The same trick won't work on me twice!

replies.content: Hehe~ You're free to challenge me again whenever you like.

comments.content: You're no ordinary poker player, I'll give you that much...

replies.content: Eyes on the prize, Commander. Whatever that might be~

author: Nyotengu
content: Humans make such curious things. Be it this "cell-fee" gadget or that airborne metal bird.

comments.content: Mikasa says the same sorta stuff sometimes!

replies.content: Oh? Does she, now?
Yeah, especially about airplanes. She still marvels over them every now and then.
Perhaps then she and I would make good acquaintances.

comments.content: It is a wonder to witness the changing times, and with it, new generations taking the place of the old.

replies.content: Ahah! Let us all get together and talk about it over some drinks! What do you say?
I do so wish to try your foreign spirits. Let us decide on a date in person.

comments.content: You mean "selfie"? A cell-fee is a bail.

replies.content: That is how you spell it? Well, I would say I've taken quite the picturesque "selfie."

comments.content: Man. I wish I could fly through the air.

replies.content: Quite. Had you wings of your own, I would take you on a journey you would late forget.

author: Kasumi
content: Woohoo! My fortune says I have a very lucky year ahead of me!

comments.content: Congratulations, Kasumi!

replies.content: I envy you, Kasumi! If only Fusou and I didn't have such unfortunate pasts... We could've used some extra luck!
Hehe~ I would share mine if I could. At least that's all behind you now!

comments.content: Is that supposed to be a big deal? I've gotten "exceptional luck" for as long as I can remember.

replies.content: Gee, I wonder if that's because you just have stupidly good luck
You guys get good fortunes? My average one reads something like "disastrous misfortune"...
Oh dear... Don't worry! Luck is relative, so every instance of bad luck will be offset eventually!

comments.content: Time to go buy a lottery ticket!

replies.content: Maybe I should! The stars seem pretty much aligned for it!

author: Honoka
content: What do you think? Could I pass as a genuine shrine maiden?

comments.content: You certainly performed the shrine maiden dance just like one! I'm impressed.

replies.content: I'm good at imitating and copying, so it was easy! Besides, you were great at teaching it to me.

comments.content: You're such a good dancer, Honoka... I wish I could move like you do...

replies.content: Practice makes perfect, Harutsuki! Want me to give you some tips?
Yes! Please do!

comments.content: I'm so happy to have made friends with another potential shrine maiden!

replies.content: And I'm so happy to have had an opportunity to hang out and practice with you Sakura Empire girls!

comments.content: Easily, Honoka.

replies.content: Hehehe, really? Aww, you're making me blush~

comments.content: Sounds like you all had fun.

replies.content: We did! Everyone I've met from the Sakura Empire has been so kind and friendly!

author: Misaki
content: Wherever you end up, you can know one thing for sure: that the stars will be super pretty.

comments.content: Ah, stargazing, are we? The beauty of the cosmos is truly something to marvel at.

replies.content: All those countless stars in an endless universe... Makes you feel tiny, doesn't it?
Wanna gaze together sometime? I'd love to learn all the constellations you have here!

comments.content: Did you see any shooting stars?

replies.content: I sure did! Lady Luck must really like me! (*_*) ☆彡
Oh! I hope I'll get to see one someday...
Let's stargaze together! Lightning might not strike the same place twice, but maybe stars do!
I'd love to... You're so nice, Misaki!

comments.content: Why not set a date for some group stargazing?

replies.content: Heck yeah! Stargazing Day, let's go!

comments.content: Stargazing seems like it takes a lot of patience and skill.

replies.content: There's a few things you need to know, but it's not much more demanding than, say, fishing!
